instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1990: What is A1990? A1990 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2018, 2019 with EMC3215, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01041, 820-01814..
definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.
definitions.PP1V8_SLPS2R: What is PP1V8_SLPS2R? PP1V8_SLPS2R is a 1.8v power rail present when the system is in a SLPS2R state. .
definitions.PP1V1_SLPS2R: What is PP1V1_SLPS2R? The PP1V1_SLPS2R power rail in the MacBook schematic provides a 1.1-volt supply in a specific low-power state indicated by the "_SLPS2R" suffix and is used for powering the T2 chip..

threads.title: Macbook Pro 15, <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hi, I have the following case:

This Macbook got spilled over the right charging ports with coffee. I noticed signs of coffee around the connector of the LCD display.
After thorough cleaning, I noticed that coil L8504 is burnt.
Voltage is stuck at 5V, current is going up to 53mA and then drops to 0A and stays like that on all USB-C ports.
There is no short circuit on the board.

Here are some measurements I did:

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC_X</SIGNAL> - OK
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> - OK
<SIGNAL>PP20V_USBC_XA_VBUS</SIGNAL> - OK
LOD on type C hubs - ОК
<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> - OK
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_T</SIGNAL> - OK
<SIGNAL>PP0V82_SLPDDR</SIGNAL> - OK
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> - OK
<SIGNAL>PP1V1_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> - OK
<SIGNAL>PP0V9_SLPDDR</SIGNAL> - OK
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_SOCPMU</SIGNAL> - OK
PPVCCPRIMCORE_PRIM_REG - ОК

I replaced all 4 USB-C hubs but no success.
When I power on the Macbook, battery is charging.
Other damage from the spillage isn't noticed.

I'm in a dead end. 
Thank you!

threads.title: Macbook Pro 15, <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Check diode mode to ground on <SIGNAL>EDP_INT</SIGNAL> lines of J8500.
Pay atention to pins 1 & 3.
Also check at pin 46.

Test the board alone on the desk; nothing connected, apart of charger.

threads.title: Macbook Pro 15, <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
I found the problem, Pin 1 and 3 have short circuit. Multiplexor <CHIP>U9850</CHIP> was faulty. Removed it and Macbook booted up on external monitor.

Thank you so much for your help! :)
